title: English (1911) Hexaplar Psalter Psalms
description:
The Hexaplar Psalter, published in 1911, is a distinctive compilation that presents the Book of Psalms in six parallel English translations. Edited by William Aldis Wright, a renowned nonconformist writer and critic, this work offers readers a comprehensive view of the evolution of English biblical translation over several centuries.

The six versions included are:

Coverdale Bible (1535)
Great Bible (1539)
Geneva Bible (1560)
Bishops' Bible (1568)
Authorized King James Version (1611)
Revised Version (1885)
By aligning these translations side by side, the Hexaplar Psalter enables readers to observe the linguistic and interpretative shifts that have occurred in the rendering of the Psalms. This format not only highlights the textual variations but also provides insights into the historical and theological contexts that influenced each translation.

The term "Hexaplar" is derived from Origen's "Hexapla," a third-century work that presented the Old Testament in six versions. Similarly, the Hexaplar Psalter serves as a valuable resource for scholars, theologians, and lay readers interested in comparative biblical studies, textual analysis, and the history of English Bible translations.
